fields_of_interest: Education and training, Business and Industry, Research and innovation, Transport
eu_initiatives: Technical requirements for inland navigation vessels by the CESNI/PT Working Group in Strasbourg and by UNECE Inland Navigation Working Party in Geneve
organisation_name: The Stichting Confederation of European Maritime Technology Societies (C.E.M.T.)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
commission_expert_groups_and_other_simil: Expert group on technical requirements for inland waterway vessels#E03496#http://ec.europa.eu/transparency/regexpert/index.cfm?do=groupDetail.groupDetail&groupID=3496#Member#C
relevant_communication:
Proposal of amendments to 2006/87/CE Directive for  
vessels not exceeding 25 m in length and authorised to carry up to a maximum of 150 passengers  
cesnipt16_55en_rev1 - 20 February 2018
goals__remit:
To provide a forum for the exchange of information and views by the constituent societies on matters relating to the education and professional development of naval architects, marine engineers and others in the field of naval technology.  
 
b.  To provide a link between the members of CEMT and the European Union, by which the constituent societies may be informed of matters relating to the education and professional development of naval architects, marine engineers and others in the field of naval technology, being discussed or considered by any body of the European Union. 
 
c.  To provide advice when requested by any body of the European Union on matters relating to the education and professional development of naval architects, marine engineers and others in the field of naval technology
